metadata.title: CVE-2021-26676 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
gdhcp in ConnMan before 1.39 could be used by network-adjacent attackers to leak sensitive stack information, allowing further exploitation of bugs in gdhcp.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-26676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

connman - 1.41-2
connman-vpn - 1.41-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: connman package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.41-2').
